Player History
Drafted in 5th round, 84th overall pick, by Cleveland in 1965...
Injured on 5/18/1965 with a Inflamed Hip Muscle, out for 6 days...
Injured on 4/6/1966 with a Hyper Extended Elbow, out for 1-2 weeks...
Traded from Cleveland to Detroit on 1/31/1971 (Going to DET: RF L. Reams, P G. Gentry, 1B L. Stanton, P J. Niekro, 3B B. Robinson. Going to CLE: 1B H. Killebrew, P D. Drysdale)...
Had first career hit (homerun) on 4/5/1971, off Denny McLain (CHW)...
Drove in 6 runs against Oakland on 4/8/1975...
Won Batter of the Month award on 6/1/1976, hitting .313 with 8 HR, 22 RBI...
Was selected to the 1976 Allstar game...
